summary: This is a TECS (Treasury Enforcement Communications System) aircraft query record from the Department of Homeland Security, dated July 1, 2019. It shows a query for an aircraft with tail number N212J, which is flagged as the subject of a current investigation. The record contains instructions to contact the record holder immediately if the aircraft is encountered or a flight plan is filed, and not to release it prior to contact.

events.title: Aircraft Query in TECS System
events.description: A query was run in the TECS system for an aircraft with tail number N212J. The aircraft is flagged as the subject of a current investigation, and specific instructions are attached for law enforcement to contact the record holder immediately upon encounter.

keyFacts: An aircraft with tail number N212J was the subject of a TECS query on July 1, 2019.
The aircraft is categorized as the 'SUBJECT OF CURRENT INVESTIGATION'.
The record contains a strict warning: 'Do not release prior to contact' and instructs any encountering agency to 'contact record holder at immediately'.
The document is marked as FOR OFFICIAL USE ONLY/LAW ENFORCEMENT SENSITIVE (FOUO/LES) and contains third-party information not to be disseminated outside the FBI without authorization.
The aircraft's registration details and descriptive information are logged in the system, though specific owner information is listed as (0), indicating no data in that field for this query.
